newsitem.title: COMOROS: Comoros government bans key union strike.
newsitem.headline: Comoros government bans key union strike.

text.p: The government in the Comoro Islands has banned demonstrations during the holy month of Ramadan in order to stop a rally by striking civil servants who have not been paid for up to 12 months.
The rally, supported by trade unionists, was scheduled to take place on Tuesday.

"The government will not accept such a demonstration which is likely to create disturbances during the sacred month of Ramadan," Information Minister Achirafi Said Hachim said on state radio late on Sunday.
The government would if necessary "act to preserve the civil peace," Hachim said.
President Mohamed Taki's government has blamed the non-payment on the disastrous state of public finances.
The impoverished Comoros have been hit by a series of strikes over the last three months, with civil servants complaining they have received no pay for up to 12 months.
